page.title: 18AMENITIES 2
page.content: MOOR MONKTON IS IN THE RURAL DISTRICT OF HARROGATE. THERE IS NO SHOP OR P.O..MAIL IS COLLECTED AND DELIVERED ONCE DAILY. THERE IS A POST BOX AND A TELEPHONE KIOSK. THE TELEPHONE EXCHANGE IS RUFFORTH AND THE POSTAL DISTRICT YORK. THERE IS NO STREET LIGHTING. ELECTRICITY WAS INTRODUCED IN 1934 AND PIPED WATER REPLACED WELLS IN 1945. THERE IS NO PUBLIC SEWERAGE DISPOSAL. DOCTOR AND NURSE COME FROM POPPLETON OR YORK. THE C.OF E. CHURCH NOW GROUPED WITH OTHER PARISHES. THE VICAR LIVES IN RUFFORTH. INTERMENTS TAKEPLACE IN THE CHURCH YARD. THERE IS NO BUS SERVICE. ACCESS TO THE VILLAGE IS ALONG CHURCH LANE(UNCLASSIFIED) FROM THE A59.THERE IS NO GARAGE OR PETROL STATION IN THE VILLAGE.A FORMER WESLEYAN CHAPEL IS NOW A HOUSE.NORTH YORKSHIRE MOBILE LIBRARY VISITS BOTH VILLAGES WEEKLY.
